messages.message: Anyone have 30 minutes today or tomorrow to help debug a really weird bug with the provenance tracking UI (mostly want to get another set of yes on it)? In order to display the highlight boxes, we calculate offset and scaling given the document pixel coordinate, and then draw it on a scaled canvas. We have two versions of the `getScaling` logic, one which works on some docs and not others, and where one doesn’t work, the other does. It may be related to input type (pdf vs image), scanned versus text pulled directly from the PDF, etc, but this bug has been there for months and it has continued to baffle me lol
I can help - have  time this afternoon after 3pm ET and tomorrow morning
let me know if you want a quick call to go over the bug or if you can just give me the code & test documents i can take a look myself too
Thanks so much Kerry! re call or code, let me prepare some materials first and then I’ll have a better idea of which may be better :+1:

In those cases where you see this bug, can you check to see whether the input image (or PDF) is the same dimension as the processed image (you can use the write_converted_image flag to see those dimensions and you can compare it to what dimensions are produced in the metadata list of the ibocr
Yup for sure, from what I can see from the logic I can't imagine it being anything but those factors
It's also possible that different canvases are used if the item to be rendered is a PDF vs image
